entry.title: Web 3.14
entry.summary: Web 3.0 has grown into Web 3.14 — an upgraded iteration of the World Wide Web which incorporates personalized AI, where you keep and control your own data.
entry.content:
Web 3.0 has grown into Web 3.14 — an upgraded iteration of the World Wide Web which incorporates personalized AI, where you keep and control your own data.

Whitepapers are in the works.

entry.title: Any Day Now
entry.summary: One sleep closer to launching a new brain. We could be talking just a matter of days here!
entry.content: One sleep closer to launching a new brain. We could be talking just a matter of days here!

entry.title: Super-boosting Humanity
entry.content:
i. First Agricultural Revolution (circa 10,000 BC)
ii. First Industrial Revolution (circa 1760)
iii. Digital Revolution (as early as the 1940s)
iv. Connectivity Revolution (1990s)
v. AI Revolution (2020s)

Absolutely mind-blowing how it only took a matter of decades for us to get from iv to v, or even iii to v.

In gaming terms, it's as if humanity is on a super-boost power-up.

entry.title: Synthetic Brain
entry.summary: One 2024 project that I am exceedingly excited about: Building our own synthetic brain A.I.
entry.content:
One 2024 project that I am exceedingly excited about: Building our own synthetic brain A.I.

It's an original type of A.I. that aims to mimic the thinking processes of the human brain, while boasting exponentially more computing power.

Identifying personalized medical solutions, creating brand new sustainable materials, solving cold cases — these are just a few examples of its potential use.

entry.title: Milkweed
entry.summary: Most milkweed flowers are poisonous to humans and pets, but at the same time can be a great nectar source for pollinators like butterflies and honeybees — \if\ they don't get trapped inside and die.
entry.content:
Most milkweed flowers are poisonous to humans and pets, but at the same time can be a great nectar source for pollinators like butterflies and honeybees — *if* they don't get trapped inside and die.

Be yourself, and the right people will come by at some point or another. Those who are not meant to be in your life are simply that.

entry.title: Exit
entry.summary: Getting a rejection is like taking an early exit on the freeway.
entry.content:
Getting a rejection is like taking an early exit on the freeway.

You are not necessarily changing your destination; perhaps you are just taking a different route to get there.

entry.title: History
entry.summary: History has repeatedly told us not to repeat it.
entry.content:
History has repeatedly told us not to repeat it.

We have been historically terrible at learning from what history tells us.

entry.title: Drones
entry.summary: Sometimes we are like drones. Bringing others down won't make you fly higher.
entry.content: Sometimes we are like drones. Bringing others down won't make you fly higher.

entry.title: Level Up
entry.summary: We will have leveled up when this is all over.
entry.content:
We will have leveled up when this is all over.

It's more than just an involuntary lockdown. Think of this period of trying times as a secret training camp — from which we will emerge stronger, more intelligent, more compassionate, and with slightly longer hair.
